byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva, Falih Hassan from Erbil, and an employee of The New York Times from Kirkuk, Iraq.

abstract: Islamic State is subjecting civilians to fresh horrors as Iraqi military moves to retake Mosul, killing nearly 200 and using others as human shields; violence provides glimpse of possible humanitarian crisis that may follow reclamation of city.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The Islamic State is carrying out mass killings and using human shields. Refugees are being turned away over fears terrorist sleeper cells. Burning sulfur has sickened dozens.
snippet: The Islamic State is carrying out mass killings and using human shields. Refugees are being turned away over fears terrorist sleeper cells. Burning sulfur has sickened dozens....

headline.main: Mosul Fight Unleashes New Horrors on Civilians
headline.print_headline: Mosul Fight Unleashes New Horrors on Civilians
